feels.name: Surprise
feels.quote: Affected by the solemnity of the scene, there was a wondering gaze of incredulous curiosity in his countenance.

feels.name: Awe
feels.quote: Oh! ye whose dead lie buried beneath the green grass; who standing among flowers can sayâ€”here, here lies my beloved; ye know not the desolation that broods in bosoms like these.

causedByEvent.name: Observing the grief of the congregation

feels.name: Sadness
feels.quote: What bitter blanks in those black-bordered marbles which cover no ashes! What despair in those immovable inscriptions!

causedByEvent.name: Reading the inscriptions on the wall

feels.name: Contemplation
feels.quote: But Faith, like a jackal, feeds among the tombs, and even from these dead doubts she gathers her most vital hope.

causedByEvent.name: Reflecting on the meaning of death and faith

feels.name: Curiosity
feels.quote: This savage was the only person present who seemed to notice my entrance; because he was the only one who could not read, and, therefore, was not reading those frigid inscriptions on the wall.

causedByEvent.name: Observing the solemnity of the scene
